result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Nicholas Daymone Love appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by phone for Nicholas Daymone Love.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received. Offer received.  Atty. Johnson has not been able to contact the defendant, the defendant provided his phone number and Atty. Johnson asked the DE to call right after the scheduling conference, request additional Scheduling Conference

11:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Daymone Love in court.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by phone for Nicholas Daymone Love. Preliminary questionnaire and waiver efiled. Court does colloquy w/deft. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. State filed information. Defense received, reading waived. Defendant enters NG plea. Atty's to pretry this case on their own, court does not give out a PTC date.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
